gw.plugin.reinsurance

Interface IReinsuranceCedingPlugin

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PCReinsuranceCedingPluginBase

    public interface IReinsuranceCedingPlugin
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin
    Interface to a configurable module for doing premium ceding calculations as part of reinsurance.

    • Method Detail

      • enqueueForCeding

        void enqueueForCeding(PolicyPeriod period,
                      RIRecalcReason reason,
                      java.lang.String comment)
        Add a PolicyPeriod to the work queue in order to get its cedings calculated. This is only used for incremental ceding, not a full recalculation.

        All ceding calculation is done via a work queue. In order to trigger the calculation, the entity which needs calculations (e.g. a whole PolicyPeriod in the case of a branch promotion) must be added to the queue.

        Parameters:
        period - The PolicyPeriod for which ceding calculations are needed
        reason - The reason that the PolicyPeriod is being calculated (for example, on Policy Bind)
        comment - a string value further describing the reason for enqueuing this period

      • calculateCedingForPeriod

        void calculateCedingForPeriod(PolicyPeriod period,
                              boolean recalculateAll,
                              RIRecalcReason reason,
                              java.lang.String comment,
                              User updateUser)
        Calculate the cedings for the given PolicyPeriod.

        This method is called by the work queue.

        Parameters:
        period - The PolicyPeriod for which ceding calculations are needed
        recalculateAll - true if all cedings on this period should be recalculated
        reason - Reason this ceding calculation is being done
        comment - If this is a recalculation, an optional comment explaining the recalc
        updateUser - user to assign activity to if work queue change caused error in ririsk

      • shouldRecalculateCeding

        boolean shouldRecalculateCeding(RICedingWorkItem workItem)
        Determines whether to recalculate cedings the given RICedingWorkItem. This method is called by the distributed worker of RICedingWorkQueue, allowing this method to be parallelized out to the workers. This method is intended to allow for some performance improvements if it is found that too many work items are recalculating based on program/agreement changes, and is called at the work item level to allow it to be parallelized across the distributed workers.
        Parameters:
        workItem - item to evaluate for recalculation
        Returns:
        true if the given WorkItem should be recalculated

      • userResponsibleForProgramChange

        User userResponsibleForProgramChange(PolicyPeriod period,
                                     RIProgram[] dirtyPrograms)
        Specify the user responsible for fixing validation errors caused by a program change. This method is called by the work queue. The user will be assigned an activity to look at/fix the job effected by the program change.
        Parameters:
        period - period that the program effected
        dirtyPrograms - list of programs that changed
        Returns:
        user responsible for fixing validation errors

      • logErrorForInvalidPrograms

        void logErrorForInvalidPrograms(java.util.List<RIProgram> programs)
        Filter out invalid programs that are to be added to the work queue for ceded premium recalculations. This method is called by the work queue. An error message will be created in the log for each invalid program.
        Parameters:
        programs - list of dirty programs that were changed

      • findRICededPremiums

        java.util.List<RICededPremium> findRICededPremiums(PolicyTerm policyTerm)
        Find all existing cedings associated with the given policy term.
        Parameters:
        policyTerm - The policy term whose cedings will be retrieved
        Returns:
        A list of all RICededPremium objects which apply to the given policy term

      • makeRICededPremium

        RICededPremium makeRICededPremium(Cost cost,
                                  Bundle bundle)
        Make a new RICededPremium entity corresponding to cost, in the given bundle.
        Parameters:
        cost - A cost which represents Direct Written Premium
        bundle - The bundle in which the cost will be created
        Returns:
        A new entity which implements the RICededPremium delegate
